field.name: Copyright notice
field.definition: a statement outlining the ways in which and circumstances under which a resource may be accessed and used

dos.practice: These best practices apply to the copyrightNotice, type, holder, and url fields.

otherPractice.header: For Articles in Journals, Newsletters, and Other Periodicals:
otherPractice.practice: Refer to OSGC Publishers and Rights Table for the copyright notice text, making sure to use the correct notice depending on if asset is uploaded and which version (final published, preprint, or postprint). If publication is not in the OSGC Publishers and Rights table, text should be: Copyright [year of publication] [copyright holder]. Check that record does not have a full-text asset.
Leave type unspecified (except for Creative Commons licenses*).
Holder should be publisher unless it was published on behalf of another organization (then choose producer).

otherPractice.header: For Books, Monographs, Book Chapters, and Encyclopedias:
otherPractice.practice: Use copyright notice from the resource's verso page. If it's not available (you can often see it using previews at Amazon.com or Google Books if not the publisher's website), use: Copyright [year of publication] [copyright holder].
Leave type unspecified (except for Creative Commons licenses*).
Holder should be publisher unless it was published on behalf of another organization (then choose producer).

For UCAR-authored resources, enter copyright notice as follows: Copyright [year] University Corporation for Atmospheric Research (UCAR). The user is granted the right to use this resource for non-commercial, non-profit research, or educational purposes only, as are more fully described in the NCAR Library Terms of Use.
Leave type unspecified.
Holder should be UCAR.
Url should be: http://www.ucar.edu/legal/terms_of_use.shtml.
For non-UCAR authorship, confirm with Jennifer or Katy that the resource should be cataloged.

otherPractice.header: For Published Proceedings (both abstracts and articles):
otherPractice.practice: Copyright notice should be: Copyright [year of publication] [copyright holder].
Leave type unspecified (except for Creative Commons licenses*).
Holder should be publisher unless it was published on behalf of another organization (then choose producer).
UCAR authorship: follow guidelines for posters and presentations above.
For non-UCAR authorship, confirm with Jennifer or Katy that resource should be cataloged.

If the resource identifies itself as having a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license, use the following for copyright notice: Copyright Author(s) [year]. This work is distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License.
For type, choose Creative commons: Attribution (by).
For holder, choose Author.
The vast majority of Creative Commons Licenses will be CC Attribution 3.0. For others, choose the corresponding type and alter the copyright statement accordingly..

documentation.example: Copyright information is unknown. Please contact the creator, author or publisher for further information.
